page.title: 04Landscape around Cilcain (3)
page.content: Caves: There are several caves in the limestone here, although the entrances are usually small and not obvious landscape features. In the Alyn Gorge local cavers have discovered two major caves in recent years. Ogof Hesp Alyn became the first cave in North Wales to be explored to over 2km, following the difficult exploration of a long extension to the previously known section. Ogof Hen Ffynonhonan is 800m in length. It has an underground stream,fed by water from swallow-holes in the River Alyn, which flows through a sizeable passage. There is also one very large chamber and some stalactite formations. This cave is now showing signs of 'human erosion', due to its popularity with parties of cavers. The 'Site of Special Scientific Interest' here includes both these cave systems, protecting them for the future.
